blog.name: cutlike-a-buffalo
blog.title: Never for money, always for love.

summary: I love Sansa... because opposite to Bran and Arya, after all that happened to her and her family she didn't become dark, her...
body: I love Sansa… because opposite to Bran and Arya, after all that happened to her and her family she didn’t become dark, her change is good. That is why she became closer to Jon, they both have that in common, they became more caring, mature and responsible, they care for their home and all the people in the North, and they are still soft in their hearts.That’s amazing character development.

reblog.comment: I love Sansa… because opposite to Bran and Arya, after all that happened to her and her family she didn’t become dark, her change is good. That is why she became closer to Jon, they both have that in common, they became more caring, mature and responsible, they care for their home and all the people in the North, and they are still soft in their hearts.That’s amazing character development.

That is why she became closer to Jon, they both have that in common, they became more caring, mature and responsible, they care for their home and all the people in the North, and they are still soft in their hearts.That’s amazing character development.

summary: Things that need some major explaining
title: Things that need some major explaining
body:
Jon pointedly looking down at his and Sansa’s hands and taking a deep breath.

The look Littlefinger gave after the crypt scene. 

     - My best guess is that he saw he was in the love triangle of Ned and Cat 2.0

LF asking Sansa, “What do you want that you cannot have?” and Sansa never answering. Obviously LF knows that there is something that isn’t making Sansa happy. What could it be?

LF saying “everything you’ve seen before will happen again” or something along those lines….I think they’re also about the Mad King that we’ll see.

tags: game of thrones characters as greek mythological figures
summary:
Game of Thrones // Greek Mythology 
Part 1 - Women of House Stark 
Catelyn Stark // Hera, Goddess of Marriage and Family
Sansa...
body:
Game of Thrones // Greek Mythology

Part 1 - Women of House Stark

Catelyn Stark // Hera, Goddess of Marriage and Family

Sansa Stark //Athena, Goddess of Wisdom and War Strategy.

Arya Stark // Artemis, Goddess of the Moon and Wilderness

Lyanna Stark // Psyche, Goddess of the Soul

blog.name: agameoftragedy
blog.title: Blame GRRM
blog.description: I used to be at least 10% more normal before I read those books. Now everything's Theon Greyjoy (and Robb Stark... and Ramsay Bolton) and everything is awful in a wonderful, wonderful way. My main blog is MzyraJ if you want more of me for some reason.

title: Discussion on Septa Mordane
body:
I find that I’m often loathe to criticise any member of House Stark and their household, I think because of how comparatively wonderful Winterfell was before the plot events start and also how many of them die in fairly short order, but… Septa Mordane. Book!Septa Mordane, I should clarify.

To be fair, we know very little about her - I don’t think we ever even establish which of the kingdoms she originates from, how old she was when she went into becoming a Septa, if she even had a choice… Maybe there are some explanations and excuses hidden there, but I’m going to have to go off of what we know in the books.

She’s essentially a teacher as her main role, and I have a lot of respect for teachers. I understand that it can be very hard to teach children properly when you have like 30 of them in a class and sometimes only for a year, as in mordern schooling. Septa Mordane, however, really only has two of them. And one of those is practically perfect by most accounts.

Honestly, how is she failing Arya this badly? Because not only is Arya not really learning what she’s meant to be, but she’s also seriously undermining her on an emotional level. Yes, Arya is more of a challenge than Sansa on the ladylike skills, but that doesn’t seem to be saying much.

I think Arya is less interested in learning these skills by the time the books begin, and that can make learning slower. It might be that she was never especially interested, perhaps a tomboy from birth. Even if that was the case, I am sure you could find ways to make the skills feel relevant to her - because you really only have two pupils, so you could have one-to-one sessions! Arya says she doesn’t want to be a lady? Alright, but who’s going to fix holes in her clothes for her then - she can learn more practical needlework! Or have her do works she’s more invested in - perhaps a blanket for Nymeria (after all, Nymeria won’t care if it’s not perfect, and practise makes perfect)?

And honestly, I’m not convinced that Arya was like this from birth - I think she’s lost interest because she’s been made to believe that she will never be good at these things (in comparison to Sansa). As she muses in her first chapter:

It wasn’t fair. Sansa had everything. Sansa was two years older; maybe by the time Arya had been born, there had been nothing left. Often it felt that way. Sansa could sew and dance and sing. She wrote poetry. She knew how to dress. She played the high harp and the bells.

Arya’s not dismissing these things; it hurts her that she can’t do them as well as Sansa. And maybe Sansa has natural talent that Arya has observed and envies, but that’s not everything. A caring teacher (who only really has two pupils!) can sit down with her, observe her at her work and see what she’s doing wrong or offer helpful pointers! And feed her interest as above! She’s not so bothered about pretty floral patterns? Do a pattern of direwolves and swords! Not everyone is Sansa! Has Septa Mordane even noticed that Arya’s left-handed? Is that why she struggles so much with some things?

Really, the girl needs her confidence boosted. I expect she may come off as confident because of how she bucks the normal rules, but from in her head we can see how much she’s really struggling with her self-esteem and position in society.

And I imagine Septa Mordane probably feels under pressure - here she is, employed by one of the highest lords of the land to make their daughters into ladies, and she’s only managing 50%! Maybe she feels like she can’t veer outside of the standard lessons and methods in case the parents disapprove, but she’s told Catelyn about Arya’s difficulties, I’m sure if she had ideas to help or fix the situation Cat and Ned could be open-minded (after all, Ned hires Syrio in OTL). They love their daughter, and they believe her getting those skills will be for her overall benefit.


I just… don’t understand how somebody tasked with educating two children (I know it seems like Jeyne Poole and Beth Cassel join in at times, but I doubt they’re a real focus in comparison) can be critically failing one of the two children this ridiculously badly. Like, I’m open to Septa Mordane defenses, but my only conclusion is that she is basically a terrible teacher who is only any good when she is handed pupils with natural aptitude at what she’s meant to be teaching.

At least TV!Septa Mordane gets that moment of defending Sansa, and I maybe wouldn’t put that past her in the books if the occasion arose, but there’s just… so little that really redeems her in the books. Maybe if she had a backstory of just wanting to live in a Motherhouse away from people or that she’s replicating her own education, but… nope.
body_abstract: I find that I’m often loathe to criticise any member of House Stark and their household, I think because of how comparatively wonderful Winterfell was before the plot events start and also how many of them die in fairly short order, but… Septa Mordane. Book!Septa Mordane, I should clarify.

blog.name: lydiaasia
blog.title: lydia
blog.description:
a freshman college student trying to understand the world
Love music

body:

summary: Do you know how many times I had to explain to people that Sansa wasn't undermining Jon, and that they were just mad that she...
body: Do you know how many times I had to explain to people that Sansa wasn’t undermining Jon, and that they were just mad that she wasn’t just blindly following their male fav? And now Bryan Cogman confirmed that she wasn’t undermining him? I feel so validated right now not going to lie.

reblog.comment: Do you know how many times I had to explain to people that Sansa wasn’t undermining Jon, and that they were just mad that she wasn’t just blindly following their male fav? And now Bryan Cogman confirmed that she wasn’t undermining him? I feel so validated right now not going to lie.

trail.content_raw: Do you know how many times I had to explain to people that Sansa wasn’t undermining Jon, and that they were just mad that she wasn’t just blindly following their male fav? And now Bryan Cogman confirmed that she wasn’t undermining him? I feel so validated right now not going to lie.
trail.content: Do you know how many times I had to explain to people that Sansa wasn’t undermining Jon, and that they were just mad that she wasn’t just blindly following their male fav? And now Bryan Cogman confirmed that she wasn’t undermining him? I feel so validated right now not going to lie.

blog.description: Collection of good posts related to GRRM ASOIAF series

title: The future of Sandor Clegane
body:
Just to leave it to the long memory of internet

Sandor Clegane will of course reappear in the story and will do many things. His future is linked to the Stark sisters, Arya and Sansa, maybe to the brotherhood without banners too. Towards the end:

  • He will be knighted by Sansa Stark, the Queen in the North
  • He will dress in Yohn Royce bronze armor. Bronze Yohn is described to be as tall as the Hound (who is dead btw) so the armor will fit. That armor has also some magic on it thanks to the runes
  • He will take Lady Forlorn valyrian sword from Lyn Corbray (Forlorn, what an apt name for Sansa right now).
  • He will be off to fight the Others

blog.name: julibf
blog.title: A Song of Ice and Fire

summary: In her own horrible way, Cersei did love Sansa.
title: In her own horrible way, Cersei did love Sansa.
body:
This line was not only about Littlefinger, it was also about Cersei and we will see this in season 8. Cersei did love Sansa, it was a selfish, destructive and fucked up love, but she did love her and tried to protect her as much as she could. I truly believe she was excited about the idea of having Sansa as a little sister after she married Tyrion and she felt betrayed and abandoned by Sansa after Joffrey assasination. Those two will be reunited one last time in season 8 and I believe it will be Sansa who will cast Cersei down.


S1E1 - In the Feast in Winterfell, Sansa and Cersei met for the first time. Cersei asks compliments Sansa beauty and asks her if she already had her period, which Sansa says she didn’t. She then asks Sansa to make a dress to her since she is so good with needlework. She seems to be charmed by the sweet and naive girl.

S1E3 -  Joffrey asks Cersei if he has to marry Sansa; she says yes: “She is very beautiful and young”!!!! Then asks him to do something nice to the Stark girl.

S2E3 - Sansa is having dinner with Cersei and her children. Myrcella asks when Sansa and Joffrey will be married and mentions that she will have a new dress for the ceremony. Sansa is obvious disturbed by the idea of marrying Joffrey and Cersei notices her behavior. Sansa lies and tells Myrcella she cant wait to pledge her love to the king, Cersei continues to watch her. She notices that Sansa is on the verge of tears. Tommen asks his mom if Joffrey wil kill Robb, Cersei believes so and mentions that even if he does, Sansa will do her duty and marry Joffrey. In this scene, Cersei actually observes Sansa reaction to the conversation and notices her sadness.


S2E7- Sansa gets her period. She is taken to Cersei and the two of them have a long conversation about this moment in Sansa’s life.  Cersei: “You are a woman now, do you have any idea what that means?” Sansa:  “ I am fit to bear children to the king”  Cersei: “a prospect that once delighted you….. bringing little princes and princesses to the world, the greatest honor to a queen.” She looks at Sansa and know she no longer wants to marry Joffrey or have his children. She then advices Sansa about love, and how it makes us weaker. Love no one but your children, On that a mother has no choice. Cersei feels badly for Sansa and tries to give her an advice to easy her pain to be engaged to Joffrey.


S2E9- Blackwater Battle. Cersei demands Sansa’s company in the High ladies Room. Sansa doesn’t know why the queen wants her company since she seems to hate her, but Shae mentions that “maybe Cersei hates Sansa less then she hates everybody else”. Cersei tries to educate Sansa about her duties as a queen and tells her how she should act and treat her subjects once she is in power. She then spends the rest of the night talking to Sansa about her childhood, about Stannis, about the Gods….Cersei likes Sansa’s company and that’s why she keeps asking her to have dinenrs with her family and to be presented on her personal chambers.She likes to have her by her side.

S2E10 – Cersei tells Joffrey in the Throne Room that he should cast Sansa aside as his future queen and cancel their engagement. At the time, we believed she was doing this to humiliated Sansa, but she was trying to protect her from Joffrey. She likes Sansa and knows Joffrey would be her worst nightmare as her husband.

S3E5 – Twyin tells Tyrion he will marry Sansa Stark. Cersei is happy about this news, in the books, she orders a new dress to be made for Sansa. I believe she was actually happy about the idea of having Sansa as her sister.

S3E8  - During the Tyrion and Sansa’s wedding ceremony, Cersei sees that Joffrey is going to torment Sansa and actually tries to stop him and advices him to go talk to his own bride instead, but he ignores his mother and goes after Sansa.

S3E10- Joffrey tells the small council he wants to give Robb’s head as a gift to Sansa but Varys explains to him that Sansa is his aunt by marriage and Cersei immediately says the Joffrey is joking and he doesn’t meant it. She is horrified by his behavior.

S3E10 – After the news of the Red Wedding have arrived to all Kings Landing, Cersei makes a visit to Tyrion. She tells him to give Sansa a child so she can have some happiness in her life. She tells Tyrion that having children was the only way she found happiness in her own life. She is worried about Sansa after the death of her mother and brother.

Cersei wil spend the rest of this story dreaming of putting her hands on Sansa again and hoping to kill her and make her pay for her betrayal, even if the betrayal happened only on her won head. Its Sansa who will cast Cersei down. I am gonna write more about those two, but i have to confess that I have never noticed how much care Cersei actually showed to Sansa in the first seasons of the series. I absolutely love their dinamic and this detail only made me love their relationship even more.

blog.name: ao3feed-sansan
blog.title: Sansan Feed
blog.description: Sansor/Sansa AO3 feed. Askbox on just in case. Happy shipping!

title: Even Porcelain Breaks
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xeyeaE

by FrozenSnares

The Starks have had poor luck. In Winterfell, there is little they can do to make their way. The oldest son sought honor through military forces, working his way through the ranks, but their family still struggles to makes ends meet. In an effort to bring wealth back, Ned Stark travels south with his two daughters where they find troubles they have never heard of before.

Words: 3044, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Sansa Stark, Arya Stark, Ned Stark, Joffrey Baratheon, Sandor Clegane
  • Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Fairy Tale, Beauty and the Beast Elements, Physical Transformation, Sister-Sister Relationship, Father-Daughter Relationship, minor physical injuries, it’s just a fluffy sansan thing, with a bit of a slow start, before the relationship builds, because i needed the story to make sense to me, and because i promised that i would write this, it just took me a while, though i’ll probably be able to manage an update a day until this thing is done, So keep an eye out, i’ll be back to your regularly scheduled Rickeen soon


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xeyeaE

trail.content:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xeyeaE

by FrozenSnares

The Starks have had poor luck. In Winterfell, there is little they can do to make their way. The oldest son sought honor through military forces, working his way through the ranks, but their family still struggles to makes ends meet. In an effort to bring wealth back, Ned Stark travels south with his two daughters where they find troubles they have never heard of before.

title: Jonsa Ghost Scene importance?
body:
So I was watching Bryan’s interview and besides picking up that he loves Sansa as much as we do, this moment left me wondering about the Jonsa + Ghost scene, they ask him about Arya and Nymeria but before even answer them he states that he actually wrote a Jon + Ghost scene that was cut later on allegedly for budget reasons and that Ghost is there around (we know which scene he’s talking about because this is the second time he brings it up) so for him at least it’s very important, what really made me feel like, WHOA! there’s something more going on here, it’s Bryan’s face after talking about this specifically scene, I mean, look a him!


the guy got nervous! i mean he handles the whole interview perfectly just there are only two times he seems to slip (the jon and sans… part, and this one)

sooo, jonsa fam, what do you think?

blog.name: queenofpanache
blog.title: ICE QUEEN
blog.description: Everything before the word 'but' is horse shit. - Jon Snow

summary: Why do people hate Sansa Stark?
body:
Why do people hate Sansa Stark?

Sure, Sansa was acting almost like a brat to Ned when he asked both his daughters to go back to Winterfell. She was all about fairytales - wanting to have a dream wedding, to marry a handsome prince, to bore him children. It was all innocent life goals to Sansa, nothing more.

Sure, Sansa was acting almost like a brat to Ned when he bought a doll for her. Can we really blame her for it? She spent her most of her time training to be a Lady - attending sewing/embroidery lessons & such. That resulted her not to play with dolls for years.. And to play with dolls at the age of 13 is a tad too old, don’t you think?

Sure, Sansa “admitted” that Ned was a “traitor”. But tell me, what would you do if you were the only Stark left in KL? Ned was imprisoned while Arya was taken away for safety purposes. Ned’s execution was not entirely her fault, you see. Yes, she wrote to Robb to bend the knee to Joffrey, BUT Sansa - in a way - did it because she was (mentally) forced to (by Cersei) & out of fear. I guess people who are hating on Sansa failed to see that Joffrey was a bully & was often not true to his words. Joffrey promised that Ned would be of mercy if he “admitted” for treason. And when Ned did, Joffrey executed him, much to everyone’s surprise.

Sansa Stark was a fragile young girl. She was rebellious & naive. But we all should know that being rebellious & naive are part of growing up. Sansa was just your typical girl who was all about fairytales & not politics.

So how is it that people hate her just because she did all that out of fear? I’m not trying to be bias, but Sansa’s character somehow managed to make almost a 360 change because she learns that life isn’t all fairytale & it takes what it takes to survive in a game of thrones.

Think about it.
